title: Viewers thank Boy George for 'honest' discussion of domestic abuse | Metro News
text:
Troy Nankervis for Metro.co.uk Friday 17 Feb 2017 11:46 pm Viewers have praised Boy George for his candid comments about family violence (Picture: ITV) 
Viewers have praised Boy George’s candid discussion of being punched and hit ‘all the time’ by his father as a young man. Sponsored 13 realities of going wedding dress shopping 
During his Friday night interview on Piers Morgan’s Life Stories , the Culture Club singer revealed his ‘loving’ relationship with his late father Jeremiah O’Dowd was complicated by physically violent outbursts. 
‘My dad was quite an extreme man. [He] could lose his temper and chuck the entire Sunday dinner over and everybody went hungry,’ he said. 
‘He hit us all the time, punched us, but everyone in the 70s punched you. It happened a lot.’ To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video Boy George says he realised how strong his mother was by age 16 (Picture: ITV) 
Becoming emotional, the singer explained his father would ‘fly off the handle quite easily’ despite being ‘extremely charismatic and funny’. 
‘He was a real contradiction and it wasn’t until I got to about 15 or 16 that I realised how strong my mum was,’ he said. George said his father was a ‘real contradiction’ (Picture: ITV) 
Many watching the interview at home took to social media to praise Boy George for sharing such an challenging moment from his private life. Such a brave and honest interview with #BoyGeorge #LifeStories Brilliant TV 👍☺
